sen.j: 木野駅（きのえき）は、京都府京都市左京区にある叡山電鉄叡山電鉄鞍馬線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in the Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City, the Kino Station is a stop on the Kurama Line, the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Kino Station, located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, is a stop on the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Kino Station, located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, is a stop on the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ無人駅。
sen.e: An unmanned station with two platforms serving two tracks which face each other.
It's an unmanned station with two platforms serving two tracks that face each other.
It's an unmanned station with two platforms serving two tracks that face each other.

sen.j: ホーム全体を覆う上屋が設置されている。
sen.e: The roofs cover the entire platforms.
The roofs cover the platforms in their entirety.
The roofs cover the entirety of the platforms.

sen.j: 出入り口はホームの出町柳駅側にある。
sen.e: Entrances are in the Demachiyanagi Station side of the platforms.
Entrances are located on the Demachiyanagi Station side of the platforms.
Entrances are located on the Demachiyanagi Station side of the platforms.

sen.j: 両ホームは駅構内踏切（第1種甲）で結ばれているが、通常無人駅で駅員配置の際の改札口もホーム上にあるため（画像参照）一般の人や自転車の横断も多い。
sen.e: Two platforms are accessed by a level crossing in the station (Class 1 Ko), which many people and bicycles cross as the station is usually unmanned and the ticket gates used when the station staff is at work are installed on the platforms (refer to the image).

Two platforms are accessed by a level crossing in the station (Class 1 Ko), which many people and bicycles cross since the station is usually unmanned and the ticket gates used when the station staff are at work are installed on the platforms (refer to the image).

Two platforms are accessed by a level crossing in the station (Class 1 Ko), which many people and bicycles cross since the station is usually unmanned and the ticket gates used when the station staff are at work are installed on the platforms (refer to the image).

sen.j: スロープも整備されているが急なため車椅子での利用には介護者が必要。
sen.e: Although the ramp is installed, caretakers are needed for a person in wheel chairs due to its sharp slope.
Although a ramp is installed, because of its steep slope caretakers are needed for persons in wheelchairs.
Although a ramp is installed, because of its steep slope caretakers are needed for persons in wheelchairs.

sen.j: 京都府道106号神山岩倉停車場線から数10m入った所。
sen.e: The station is located several tens of meters from the Kouyama-iwakura Teishajosen Kyoto Fudo 106 Go (Kyoto Prefecture Road 106).
The station is located several tens of meters from the Kouyama-iwakura Teishajosen Kyoto Fudo 106 Go (Kyoto Prefecture Road 106).
The station is located several tens of meters from the Koyama-Iwakura Teishajo Line Kyoto Prefectural Route 106.
sen.cmt: 京都府道106号神山岩倉停車場線→Koyama-Iwakura Teishajo Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 106

sen.j: 周辺は戸建て中心の住宅地。
sen.e: The surrounding is a residential area mainly of independent houses.
The surroundings comprise a residential area, mainly of free-standing homes.
The surroundings comprise a residential area, mainly of free-standing homes.

sen.j: 府道沿いを除き田畑も多かったか、区画整理が進んできている。
sen.e: Many rice and vegetable fields were seen except the area along the Prefecture Road, but recently the land readjustment has been promoted.
Many rice and vegetable fields could formerly be seen except for the area along the Prefecture Road, but in recent years land readjustment has been promoted.
Many rice and vegetable fields could formerly be seen except for the area along the Prefectural Route, but in recent years land readjustment has been promoted.

sen.j: 以前は数100m西の踏切沿いにあり、街道が交わる小さな集落の中心（京都バスの終点にもなっていた）の横という場所であった。
sen.e: Previously, the station was located along the railroad crossing which lay several hundreds of meters in the westward direction, or adjacent to the center of a small settlement (the final stop of the Kyoto Bus) where the roads cross.

Previously, the station was located along the railroad crossing that lay several 100 meters to the west, or adjacent to the center of a small settlement (the final stop of the Kyoto Bus) where the roads crossed.

Previously, the station was located along the railroad crossing that lay several 100 meters to the west, or adjacent to the center of a small settlement (the final stop of the Kyoto Bus) where the roads crossed.

sen.j: 1968年に京都精華大学（当時）が開校後、京都精華大前駅が1989年に開業するまで同校のもより駅となり、駅から学校までの街道（現：府道106号）沿いに学生アパートが多く建設された。
sen.e: After the establishment of the Kyoto Seika University (formerly) in 1968 until 1989 when the Kyoto Seikadaimae Station opened, the station served as the nearest station from the university, and many apartments rented for students were built along the road (currently Prefecture Road 106) between the station and the university.

After the establishment of the former Kyoto Seika University in 1968 until 1989, when the Kyoto Seikadaimae Station opened, the station served as the nearest station from the university, and many rental apartments for students were built along the road (currently Prefecture Road 106) between the station and the university.

After the 1968 establishment of the former Kyoto Seika University until 1989, when the Kyoto Seikadaimae Station opened, the station served as the nearest station from the university, and many rental apartments for students were built along the road (currently Prefectural Route 106) between the station and the university.

sen.j: また1980年に開校された 京都府立北稜高等学校の目の前であった。
sen.e: The station was located in front of the Kyoto Prefectural Hokuryo Senior High School, which was established in 1980.
The station was located in front of the Kyoto Prefectural Hokuryo Senior High School, which was established in 1980.
The station was located in front of the Kyoto Prefectural Hokuryo Senior High School, which was established in 1980.

sen.j: しかし1990年に京都精華大前駅開設と複線化のため、南側の区画整理された住宅地に近い現在の場所に移転している。
sen.e: However, after the Kyoto Seikadaimae Station opened in 1990 and for the double tracking, the station was transferred to the current location closed to the residential area in the south side where land readjustment proceeded

However, after the Kyoto Seikadaimae Station opened in 1990 and, for the purpose of double-tracking, the station was transferred to the current location close to the residential area in the south side, where land readjustment had been implemented.

However, after the Kyoto Seikadaimae Station opened in 1990 and, for the purpose of double-tracking, the station was transferred to the current location close to the residential area in the south side, where land readjustment had been implemented.

sen.j: 京都府立北稜高等学校
sen.e: Kyoto Prefectural Hokuryo Senior High School
Kyoto Prefectural Hokuryo Senior High School
Kyoto Prefectural Hokuryo Senior High School

sen.j: あんた橋
sen.e: Anta-bashi Bridge
Anta-bashi Bridge
Anta-bashi Bridge

sen.j: 妙満寺
sen.e: Myoman-ji Temple
Myoman-ji Temple
Myoman-ji Temple

sen.j: 一条山（現駅横の小さな丘。開発の中断で一時禿山状態で放置され有名になった）
sen.e: Ichijosan (A small hill next to the current station. It became famous as it was left as a bald hill due to the temporary halt of the development.)
Ichijosan is a small hill next to the current station. It became famous because it was left as a bald hill due to the temporary halt of development.)
Ichijosan (a small hill next to the current station. It became famous because it was left as a bald hill due to the temporary halt of development.)
sen.cmt: 最初の訳に戻しました。

sen.j: 円通寺 (京都市) 南西へ1km強
sen.e: One kilometers to the southwest is the Entsu-ji Temple (Kyoto City).
Entsu-ji Temple (Kyoto City) is located a kilometer to the southwest.
Entsu-ji Temple (Kyoto City) is located a kilometer to the southwest.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）12月1日 鞍馬電気鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: The station opened on December 1, 1928, as a station owned by the Kurama Electric Railway.
The station opened on December 1, 1928 under the ownership of the Kurama Electric Railway.
December 1, 1928: The station opened under the ownership of the Kurama Electric Railway.

sen.j: 現駅より数百mほど西にある踏切の東（現駅）側にあった。
sen.e: The station was located on the east side (current station) of the level crossing which lies several hundreds of meters in the westward direction from the current station.
The station was located on the east side (the current station) of the level crossing, several hundred meters west of the current location.
The station was located on the east side (the current station) of the level crossing, several hundred meters west of the current location.

sen.j: また車庫が併設されていた。
sen.e: The station had a train shed.
The station had a train shed.
The station had a train depot.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）8月1日 会社合併により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On August 1, 1942, the station came to be owned by the Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of amalgamation.
On August 1, 1942 the station came under the ownership of the Keifuku Electric Railroad due to the amalgamation.
August 1, 1942: The station came under the ownership of the Keifuku Electric Railroad due to the amalgamation.

sen.j: 1944年（昭和19年）11月10日 当駅を含む、山端（現・宝ヶ池駅）～二軒茶屋駅 (京都府)間が、戦争に伴う資材供出のため単線化。
sen.e: On November 10, 1944, the line between the Yamabana Station (currently called Takaragaike Station) and the Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), including the Kino Station, became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

On November 10, 1944 the line between Yamabana Station (currently called Takaragaike Station) and Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), including Kino Station, became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

November 10, 1944: The line between Yamabana Station (currently called Takaragaike Station) and Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), including Kino Station, became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

sen.j: 踏切の西側に移設。
sen.e: The station was transferred on the west side of the level crossing.
The station was transferred to the west side of the level crossing.
The station was transferred to the west side of the level crossing.

sen.j: 車庫はすでになかったということであるが詳細不明。
sen.e: The train shed supposedly did not exist at the time, but details are unknown.
The train shed supposedly did not exist at the time, but the details are unknown.
The train depot supposedly didn't exist at the time, but the details are unknown.

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）4月1日 会社譲渡により叡山電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1986, the station came to be owned by the Eizan Electric Railway as a result of transfer of the company.
On April 1, 1986 the station came under the ownership of the Eizan Electric Railway due to the transfer of the company.
April 1, 1986: The station came under the ownership of the Eizan Electric Railway due to the transfer of the company.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）9月28日 岩倉駅 (京都府)-二軒茶屋駅間が再複線化され、数百mほど東に移転。
sen.e: On September 28, 1990, the line between the Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and the Nikenchaya Station became a double track again, thereby to transfer the station several hundreds of meters in the eastward direction.
On September 28, 1990 the line between Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nikenchaya Station became a double track again, thereby to transfer the station several hundred meters eastward.
September 28, 1990: The line between Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nikenchaya Station became a double track again, thereby to transfer the station several hundred meters eastward.

sen.j: 叡山電鉄
sen.e: Eizan Electric Railway
Eizan Electric Railway
Eizan Electric Railway

sen.j: 鞍馬線
sen.e: Kurama Line
Kurama Line
Kurama Line

sen.j: 岩倉駅 (京都府) - 木野駅 - 京都精華大前駅
sen.e: Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Kino Station - Kyoto Seikadaimae Station
Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Kino Station - Kyoto Seikadaimae Station
Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Kino Station - Kyoto Seikadaimae Station
